items.title: What Makes a City Great?
items.abstract: What’s wonderful about the city you live in or know best? How could it reinvent itself to make life for residents even better?

items.title: Lesson Plan: ‘An Ailing Arkansas City Elected an 18-Year-Old Mayor to Turn Things Around’
items.abstract: In this lesson, students will consider what it takes to become an elected official at a young age, and identify a community issue they would tackle if they were mayor.

items.title: Higher Learning in a Hybrid City
items.abstract: Don Hall and Chris Williams, the directors of “Big Hero Six,” and Paul Felix, its production designer, describe the film’s San Fransokyo Institute of Technology campus.

items.title: Learning to Love ‘the People’s Food’ in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
items.abstract: At Vietnamese restaurants in America, all kinds of foods are served together — noodles, soups, stir-frys, spring rolls. But in Vietnam, restaurants are often devoted to a single dish.

items.title: Learning With: ‘How China Turned a City Into a Prison’
items.abstract: The Chinese government is using high-tech mass surveillance to turn a city with an ethnic and Muslim minority into a virtual cage? Is this the future of technology?
